value: How can I avoid losing work?
How can I find and use other people's data?
How can I find and use other people's software?
How can I be more productive?
How can I make it easy for people to collaborate with me?
How can I make it easy for people to find and use my data?
How can I make it easy for programs to use my data?
How can I make it easy for people to find and use my software?
How can I tell if my results are correct?
Put everything created by people into version control.
Provide simple re-runnable end-to-end test cases.
Maintain a checklist of things to do before sharing a change.
Submit data to a reputable DOI issuer.
Give values, functions, and classes meaningful names.
Include a README file explaining project scope.
Give every record a unique key.
Keep the master copy of every manuscript on the web.
Prefer open text formats to proprietary non-text formats.
Maintain a to-do list for each project.
Record publishing steps like analysis steps.
Re-use libraries rather than writing equivalents.
Run tests automatically before each commit.
Make it easy to set up a development environment.
Submit software to a reputable DOI issuer.
Use path names that are easy to sort and to match.
Make the preferred citation for projects explicit.
Store raw data exactly as it arrived.
Store work in a remotely-hosted version control repository.
Use configuration files and conditionals rather than commenting.
Break programs into short, self-contained functions.
Use text values that are easy to match with regular expressions.
Store data in a relational database.
Write unit tests to specify and check behavior.
